body_html:
After seeing this answer on SO about it, I guess intermediate tensors are not guaranteed to have useful data, only the graph output(s). That makes sense for memory reasons, so I probably shouldn't expect this to work anytime soon.

I was able to (hackily) achieve what I needed by modifying the .tflite file with different output tensor indices and re-running the interpreter for each new output tensor.

Maybe the documentation can be updated to note that get_tensor() and tensor() can't be used to read intermediate results?

body:
After seeing [this answer](https://stackoverflow.com/a/53105809) on SO about it, I guess intermediate tensors are not guaranteed to have useful data, only the graph output(s). That makes sense for memory reasons, so I probably shouldn't expect this to work anytime soon.

I was able to (hackily) achieve what I needed by modifying the .tflite file with different output tensor indices and re-running the interpreter for each new output tensor.

Maybe the documentation can be updated to note that get_tensor() and tensor() can't be used to read intermediate results?
